intro: Guioa sulphurea, commonly known as the golden guioa, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the Philippines and is characterized by its fragrant, yellowish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized evergreen tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a glossy, dark green upper surface. The fruit is a small, spherical drupe that turns from green to yellow or orange when mature.
